title: How to Make Middle Eastern Tea

steps.headline: Put all the ingredients in the saucepan.
steps.description: Don't turn the stove on yet. (To put the cardamom in, give it a bite to open it and then put the little black seeds in the saucepan. Throw away the green shell.)

steps.headline: Turn the stove on low-medium heat and pop the saucepan on top.
steps.description: Wait ten minutes, or until the tea goes brown and starts to bubble.

steps.headline: When it goes bubbly and dark, turn the stove off.
steps.description: Wait a few minutes to let the tea cool slightly. Use a spoon to carefully take the teabag out. Throw it away.

steps.headline: Carefully, without burning yourself, take the saucepan off and pour it cautiously into the mug.
Add your desired amount of sugar.

text: Put all the ingredients in the saucepan. Don't turn the stove on yet. (To put the cardamom in, give it a bite to open it and then put the little black seeds in the saucepan. Throw away the green shell.) Turn the stove on low-medium heat and pop the saucepan on top. Wait ten minutes, or until the tea goes brown and starts to bubble. When it goes bubbly and dark, turn the stove off. Wait a few minutes to let the tea cool slightly. Use a spoon to carefully take the teabag out. Throw it away. Carefully, without burning yourself, take the saucepan off and pour it cautiously into the mug. Wipe up any spills immediately. Add your desired amount of sugar. Try one teaspoon. Finished.
